p: Dengue dynamics in endemic regions are complex, characterised by continual lineage turnover and changes in prevalence [ 146, 147]. These lineage turnover dynamics have however been classified on a genetic level as following two non-mutually exclusive patterns, (i) an incremental spectrum of dead-end variants within lineages and (ii) dramatic replacements of lineages [ 144, 147]. Recent phylogenies based on E genome sequences have identified five genotypes in DENV1 and 2, and four genotypes in DENV3 and 4 [ 142, 148].
